name: Regime numbers - OWID based on Lührmann et al. (2018), V-Dem (11.1), OWID (2021)
title: Regime numbers - OWID based on Lührmann et al. (2018), V-Dem (11.1), OWID (2021)
description:
This dataset provides information on the number of countries having different political systems.

Political regimes are identified using the Regimes of the World classification from Lührmann et al. (2018), data from the Varieties of Democracy Project (v11.1), and expanding the data and refining the classification ourselves.

The classification distinguishes between closed autocracies, electoral autocracies, electoral democracies, and liberal democracies.

sources.name: OWID based on Lührmann et al. (2018), V-Dem (v11.1)
sources.additionalInfo:
This dataset provides information on the number of countries having different political systems.

Political regimes are identified using the Regimes of the World classification from Lührmann et al. (2018), data from the Varieties of Democracy Project (v11.1), and expanding the data and refining the classification ourselves.

The classification distinguishes between closed autocracies, electoral autocracies, electoral democracies, and liberal democracies.
sources.dataPublishedBy: Our World in Data, Bastian Herre
sources.dataPublisherSource: Data on regimes comes from the Varieties of Democracy project (v11.1), using Lührmann et al's (2018) classification, and own expansions and refinements; population data comes from our own calculations based on Gapminder (v6), HYDE (v3.2), and UN (2019).
